DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Secondary Diagnosis Four Factor Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records the patient's preexisting medical conditions, factors influencing health status, and/or complications for the treatment of this cancer using ICD-10-CM codes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Secondary Diagnosis Four Factor
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome._Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one._Anything that contributes causally to a result.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.:Anything that contributes causally to a result.

Concepts.definition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
Anything that contributes causally to a result.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: ICD-10-CM codes used for recording the patient's pr-existing medical conditions, factors influencing health status, and/or complications during the hospital stay for the treatment of cancer.  All are considered secondary diagnoses.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:Factor; anything that contributes causally to a result.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
Anything that contributes causally to a result.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences
